alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:50AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Montgomery and Stewart Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 550 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms centered near Big Rock, or 10 miles north of Dover, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Dover, Big Rock, Land Between The Lakes, Indian Mound and Woodlawn. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
